job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
CENIC's Software Engineers design, build, and implement robust software solutions to advance CENIC’s organizational goals and objectives, including support of the CENIC network.&nbsp;This position provides advanced-level programming expertise for a variety of system integrations, tools development, software support, and troubleshooting activities.&nbsp;The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing high-quality applications. They will also be responsible for designing and implementing testable and scalable code.&nbsp;&nbsp;Key Success Factors  - Experience with and strong understanding of object-oriented design principles   
  - Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a diverse team-oriented environment   
  - Adept at understanding technical information and learning new concepts   
  - Strong interest in learning about networking concepts and technologies   
   Responsibilities  - Develop quality software applications   
  - Analyze and maintain existing software applications   
  - Design highly scalable, testable code   
  - Document code consistently throughout the development process   
  - Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve problems relating to internal mission-critical software applications   
  - Work with stakeholders to define requirements and implement software used to instrument, manage, and troubleshoot large-scale diverse networks   
  - Use robust and secure software development principles: robust exception-handling, input validation, proper application and use of cryptographic algorithms and libraries, proper handling of concurrency issues   
   Qualifications  - 5+ years of full-time software engineering experience   
  - Proficiency in at least one backend server language such as Java, Scala, Go, or Python (we use Python)   
  - Production experience with database systems - SQL and/or NoSQL (we use Postgres, ElasticSearch)   
  - Experience working in Agile and SCRUM methodologies   
  - Experience working with CI/CD tools   
  - Experience working with package managers such as Maven, PyPI, and NPM&nbsp;   
  - Experience working with version control systems (we use git)   
  - Experience working with a major cloud platform (AWS preferred)   
  - Familiarity with Docker and container orchestration systems   
  - Familiarity with APIs and microservices   
   About CENICJoin the team that&nbsp;connects California to the world&nbsp;— advancing education and research statewide by providing the world-class computing network essential for innovation, collaboration, and economic growth. Our organization operates the California Research and Education Network (CalREN), a high-capacity computer network with more than 8,000 miles of optical fiber. The network serves over 20 million users across California, including the vast majority of K-20 students together with educators, researchers, and individuals at other vital public-serving institutions.   Why work at CENIC?  - Company Culture:&nbsp;Small teams and a collaborative environment provide the opportunity to make a large impact in a small organization.   
  - Workplace Flexibility:&nbsp;We understand that the world is changing and we're open to remote and hybrid work options.   
  - Community Engagement:&nbsp;We work with research and education institutions in the largest state economy in the United States. The work you do has meaning.   
  - Health Benefits:&nbsp;We have generous medical benefits as well as dental, vision, and life insurance.   
  - Paid Time Off:&nbsp;We offer liberal vacation, holiday, and sick leave.   
  - Investment in Your Future:&nbsp;CENIC contributes to your 403(b) even if you don't. We also offer matching contributions on top of that.   
   Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.   LocationCENIC has two California offices, the home office in La Mirada and a smaller office in Berkeley. This position is based out of our La Mirada office.&nbsp;Please note due to COVID-19 this position is temporarily remote and not expected to be back in the office until conditions in the state of California improve.
